Intro: Big believer in constant self-improvement and growth. Productivity freak and a philomath with an eclectic range of interests. Iâ€™ve been into the world of programming since 2012. I started with C++, then Java, .NET (C#) and in later years JavaScript, PHP and Python. My focus in the field right now is Full Stack Web Development with expanding interest in Mobile Development, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.

Passions.Name: Weightlifting
Passions.Desc: To perform at my best I have to stay in shape. Simple as that. Can't function properly unless I get a therapy session regularly. Most of my business and application ideas came while in the gym. The rest - in the shower.

Passions.Name: Rockclimbing
Passions.Desc: As someone who fears heights, rock climbing has recently become a challenging but rewarding hobby. Quite addictive, as well.

Passions.Name: Music
Passions.Desc: Life without music would be a mistake - as Nietzsche said. I agree as a wholehearted consumer and occasional creator.

Passions.Name: Software Development
Passions.Desc: I consider myself a creator. As such, the choice of software development as a career path follows naturally. As a developer, I have the power to build almost anything. In the vast sea of software development, I currently cruise around web, mobile, and machine learning.

Passions.Name: Reading / Writing
Passions.Desc: As someone who takes pleasure in developing - writing is a natural inclination even if it has not always been the case. Reading keeps me growing and sane.

Passions.Name: Psychology / Philosophy
Passions.Desc: I believe psychology should be mandatory education found in every school curriculum just as science and software development. It helps understand yourself and maybe even people in general. Philosophy, on the other hand, helps understand life.

Passions.Name: Personal Development
Passions.Desc: In my opinion, in order to live a fulfilled life, balance is key. Balance in the sense of building yourself to a complete person. For me, that means keeping my body in shape, enhance my athletism, hone the mind, and cultivate my creativity.

Passions.Name: Neuroscience
Passions.Desc: I have not achieved the level of proficiency I would like to have in this field. However, I still find the hardware of our brains just as fascinating as it's software. Especially, its applicability to computer science.

Projects.Name: ADB Studios
Projects.Description: An ultra-responsive, cross-browser supported portfolio website.

WIL: Stack: React, SASS, Git, JSON, Netlify
WIL: SoC, Continuous Delivery with Netlify, SASS Mixin, Media Queries, Grid, Flexbox

Projects.Name: Pixel Art Maker
Projects.Description: A custom-made canvas for drawing with pixels - project part of the Udacity Front-End Nanodegree program.

WIL: WIL: Working with the DOM, Dynamically add and remove HTML elements, Use JS to dynamically alter CSS properties, JS Events

Projects.Name: Smallest Common Multiple
Projects.Description: Simple script that finds the SCM of two numbers. Challenge by freeCodeCamp that I decided to add some color to.

WIL: Stack: HTML, JS, SASS, jQuery, Webpack 3
WIL: Minimalist Style, Color & Font, Manual configuration for Webpack 3 from scratch, Writing JSON files, Webpack Loaders, Babel

Projects.Name: Intermediate Algorithms
Projects.Description: Beginner and intermediate algorithms from freeCodeCamp' JS Algorithm and DS Certification path.

WIL: WIL: Working with pure JS, String Algorithms, Regular Expressions, Functional JS, Intermediate Algorithms

Projects.Name: Python Web Scraper
Projects.Description: Web scraper that collects data from a single HTML page exporting the data into an excel file.

WIL: WIL: Web scraping with Python, Authentication, Generate Excel files, Import / Export Excel data, HTML Parsing

Projects.Name: Matching Game
Projects.Description: Card game to test your memory - project part of the Udacity Front-End Nanodegree program.

WIL: WIL: Working with existing codebase, Writing READMEs, Functional JS

Projects.Name: The Frogger - Arcade Game
Projects.Description: Frogger-like arcade game. Project part of the Udacity Front-End Nanodegree program.

WIL: WIL: Basic game development, Working with an existing game engine and resources, Object-Oriented JS, Working with coordinates, Keyboard controls, Writing READMEs
